titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Department of Afro-American Studies Records CA.MS.00134
titlestmt.author: Elisha Winkler

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-11-15 13:47:42 -0500.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)
Containers added and finding aid updated as part of College Archives survey

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Smith College. Dept. of Afro-American Studies.

did.abstract: This collection contains literary journals, photographs, pamphlets, course listings, meeting minutes, newspaper clippings, paper assignments, final and mid-year exams, and assorted fliers.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Afro-American Studies Department at Smith College was established in 1970. Smith was one of the first colleges to establish an Afro-American Studies department.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Afro-American Studies Department records contain materials describing the offerings and activities of the department. Types of materials include various photographs of faculty as well as original copies of student literary magazines, Afro-American Studies at Smith pamphlets, department announcements, minutes from the Committee on Afro-American Studies, paper assignments, exam questions, and one copy of the Smith College Journal of Afro-American Studies.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Department of Afro-American Studies Records, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00134, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Accession 02A-40, 8.5 linear feet. Box listing available in College Archives. Portions are restricted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Afro-American Studies Department records were created by the department and transferred to the College Archives over a period of time.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

controlaccess.corpname: Smith College. Dept. of Afro-American Studies.
